org.jetel.data.parser

Interface Parser

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ICloverDataParser, IHadoopSequenceFileParser, TextParser
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractParser, AbstractTextParser, BinaryDataParser, ByteBufferParser, CharByteDataParser, CloverDataParser, CloverDataParser35, DataParser, DataRecordGenerator, DBFDataParser, DelimitedDataParser, FixLenByteDataParser, FixLenCharDataParser, FixLenDataParser, JExcelXLSDataParser, LdapParser, SimpleDataParser, SQLDataParser, XLSParser, XLSXDataParser, XPathParser

    public interface Parser
    Interface to input data parsers
    Since:
    March 27, 2002
    See Also:

        The Next value

        March 27, 2002

      • isDirectReadingSupported

        boolean isDirectReadingSupported()
        Returns true if the current file can be parsed using direct reading.
        Returns:
        true if direct reading is possible

      • getNextDirect

        int getNextDirect(CloverBuffer buffer)
                  throws JetelException
        Reads the next serialized record into the provided buffer. The target buffer is cleared first.

        The position of the target buffer will be set to 0 and the limit will be set to the end of the serialized record.

        Returns 0 to indicate EOF. 1 on Success -1if direct reading can be performed for current data source

        Parameters:
        targetBuffer - the target buffer
        Returns:
        0 to indicate EOF. 1 on Success -1if direct reading can be performed for current data source
        Throws:
        JetelException

      • skip

        int skip(int nRec)
         throws JetelException
        Skips specified number of records.
        Parameters:
        nRec - Number of records to be skipped.
        Returns:
        Number of skipped records.
        Throws:
        JetelException

      • setDataSource

        void setDataSource(java.lang.Object inputDataSource)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          ComponentNotReadyException
        Sets input data source. Some of parsers allow to call this method repeatedly.
        Parameters:
        inputDataSource -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if releasing of previous source failed
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • setReleaseDataSource

        void setReleaseDataSource(boolean releaseInputSource)
        If releaseInputSource is false, the previous input data source is not released (input stream is not closed). The input data source release is performing into the method 'setDataSource'. Default value is true.
        Parameters:
        releaseInputSource -

      • preExecute

        void preExecute()
                throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Life-cycle hook. Follows the semantics of Node.preExecute() Called by the owner of the parser before each graph phase execution.
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - Catch-all exception

      • postExecute

        void postExecute()
                 throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Life-cycle hook. Follows the semantics of Node.postExecute() Called by the owner of the parser after each graph phase execution. NOTE! postExecute should do exactly the same thing as deprecated method reset(). The only advantage over reset() is that it matches with the name of Node's life-cycle method postExecute().
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - Catch-all exception

      • free

        void free()
          throws ComponentNotReadyException,
                 java.io.IOException
        Life-cycle hook. Follows the semantics of Node.free() Called by the owner of the parser to release resources when the parser is not needed anymore NOTE! free() should do exactly the same thing as deprecated method close(). The only advantage over close() is that it matches with the name of Node's life-cycle method free().
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - Catch-all exception
        java.io.IOException

      • nextL3Source

        boolean nextL3Source()
        Used to move to the next subsection of an input source where applicable. Example: For XLS files each sheet is considered a separate subsection, upon reaching end of sheet getNext() call returns null, this may be followed by a nextL3Source() call; if the call succeeds reading may continue. Implementation for parsers that do not deal with data inputs with multiple subsections should always return false. Naming explanation: level 1 (L1) - all inputs to be processed, level 2 (L2) - individual inputs in L1, level 3 (L3) - individual subsections in L2.
        Returns:
        true on success, false if no more subsections are available

      • getPreferredDataSourceType

        Parser.DataSourceType getPreferredDataSourceType()
        Parser can request specific data source type, which is preferred to be passed into setDataSource(Object) method. This is intended just a hint for source provider, so other types of source should be expected.
